subject: Relationships
title: Oxytocin: The Trust Molecule
description: One-minute skill: Oxytocin: The Trust Molecule.

hook.text: Spray oxytocin in someone's nose and they'll trust strangers with their money. One molecule changes the entire equation.

buildup.text: Paul Zak's experiments showed that oxytocin nasal spray increased financial trust by 44% in laboratory games.

discovery.text: Oxytocin doesn't create blind trust. It reduces the brain's fear response, lowering the barrier to vulnerability.

twist.text: Hugs release oxytocin naturally. A 20-second hug is enough to measurably increase trust between two people.

climax.text: Trust has a molecule. But it's not magic â€” it works by quieting fear long enough for connection to happen.

punchline.text: Oxytocin quiets fear so trust can happen. A 20-second hug triggers it.

quiz.question: How does oxytocin affect trust?
options: It reduces the brain's fear response
